articles.title: How to spot a fake AI crying infant/child
articles.author: Heidi Heil STOPS Thymectomy
articles.summary: AI babies and children have several key differences from real ones. Real ones have skin that rarely, if ever, wrinkles. Extreme expressions of distress result in skin movements with mostly dimples and ripples. AI seems to prefer deeply shadowed scenes and it's more likely that a video showing a child with extreme features is fake.

articles.title: LLM Optimization: Huawei Shrinks AI Models for Any Device

articles.title: Living Computers: Human Cells Power Next Tech Leap
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Biocomputing uses biological materials to perform computational tasks. Organoids are three-dimensional, miniature versions of organs grown from stem cells. They mimic the brain's inherent parallel processing capabilities. Advances in optogenetics (using light to control neurons) and microfluidics (manipulating fluids at a microscopic scale) are enabling better communication with organoids.
